estion "Find the value of \(\dfrac{a+b}{2}\) where \(g(x) = 3x + 2\) and \(g(x) = 2f^{-1}(x)\) for the function \(f(x) = ax+b\)", we need to:
Determine what \(g(x) = 2f^{-1}(x)\) tells us about \(f^{-1}(x)\).
Express \(f^{-1}(x)\) based on the given relationship \(g(x) = 3x + 2\).
Consider the form of the inverse function \(f^{-1}(x)\) if \(f(x) = ax + b\).
Derive the expression for \(f(x)\) based on the determined form of \(f^{-1}(x)\).
Relate this expression of \(f(x)\) to the standard form \(f(x) = ax + b\) to find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).
Calculate \(\dfrac{a+b}{2}\).
